verses.verse: David<WH1732> therefore departed<WH3212> there,<WH4422> and escaped to the cave<WH4631> of Adullam.<WH5725> When his brothers<WH251> and all his father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> heard<WH8085> it,<WH3381> they went down there to him.

Everyone<WH376> who was in distress,<WH4689> and everyone<WH376> who was in debt,<WH5378> and everyone<WH376> who was discontented,<WH4751> gathered<WH6908> themselves to him;<WH8269> and he became captain over them:<WH702> and there were with him about four hundred<WH3967> men.<WH376>

David<WH1732> went<WH3212> there to Mizpeh<WH4708> of Moab,<WH4124> and he said<WH559> to the king<WH4428> of Moab,<WH4124> "Please let my father<WH1> and my mother<WH517> come out<WH3318> with you,<WH3045> until I know what God<WH430> will do for me.<WH6213>"
He brought<WH5148> them before<WH6440> the king<WH4428> of Moab;<WH4124> and they lived<WH3427> with him all the while<WH3117> that David<WH1732> was in the stronghold.<WH4686>

The prophet<WH5030> Gad<WH1410> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Don't<WH3427> stay in the stronghold.<WH4686> Depart,<WH3212> and go<WH935> into the land<WH776> of Judah.<WH3063>" Then David<WH1732> departed,<WH3212> and came<WH935> into the forest<WH3293> of Hereth.<WH2802>

Saul<WH7586> heard<WH8085> that David<WH1732> was discovered,<WH3045> and the men<WH582> who were with him.<WH7586> Now Saul was sitting<WH3427> in Gibeah,<WH1390> under the tamarisk tree<WH815> in Ramah,<WH7414> with his spear<WH2595> in his hand,<WH3027> and all his servants<WH5650> were standing about him.<WH5324>

Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to his servants<WH5650> who stood<WH5324> about him,<WH8085> "Hear now, you Benjamites!<WH1145> Will the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> give<WH5414> everyone of you fields<WH7704> and vineyards,<WH3754> will he make<WH7760> you all captains<WH8269> of thousands<WH505> and captains<WH8269> of hundreds,<WH3967>

that all of you have conspired<WH7194> against me,<WH1540> and there is none who discloses to me when my son<WH1121> makes a treaty<WH3772> with the son<WH1121> of Jesse,<WH3448> and there is none of you who is sorry<WH2470> for me,<WH1540> or discloses to me that my son<WH1121> has stirred up<WH6965> my servant<WH5650> against me,<WH693> to lie in wait, as at this day?<WH3117>"

Then Doeg<WH1673> the Edomite,<WH130> who stood<WH5324> by the servants<WH5650> of Saul,<WH7586> answered<WH559> and said,<WH559> "I saw<WH7200> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> coming<WH935> to Nob,<WH5011> to Ahimelech<WH288> the son<WH1121> of Ahitub.<WH285>
He inquired<WH7592> of Yahweh<WH3068> for him,<WH5414> gave him food,<WH6720> and gave<WH5414> him the sword<WH2719> of Goliath<WH1555> the Philistine.<WH6430>"

Then the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971> to call<WH7121> Ahimelech<WH288> the priest,<WH3548> the son<WH1121> of Ahitub,<WH285> and all his father<WH1>'s house,<WH1004> the priests<WH3548> who were in Nob:<WH5011> and they came<WH935> all of them to the king.<WH4428>
Saul<WH7586> said,<WH559> "Hear<WH8085> now,<WH1121> you son of Ahitub.<WH285>" He answered,<WH559> "Here I am,<WH113> my lord."

Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to him,<WH7194> "Why have you conspired against me,<WH1121> you and the son of Jesse,<WH3448> in that you have given<WH5414> him bread,<WH3899> and a sword,<WH2719> and have inquired<WH7592> of God<WH430> for him,<WH6965> that he should rise against me,<WH693> to lie in wait, as at this day?<WH3117>"

Then Ahimelech<WH288> answered<WH6030> the king,<WH4428> and said,<WH559> "Who among all your servants<WH5650> is so faithful<WH539> as David,<WH1732> who is the king<WH4428>'s son-in<WH2860>-law, and is taken<WH5493> into your council,<WH4928> and is honorable<WH3513> in your house?<WH1004>

Have I today<WH3117> begun<WH2490> to inquire<WH7592> of God<WH430> for him?<WH2486> Be it far from me! Don't<WH4428> let the king impute<WH7760> anything<WH1697> to his servant,<WH5650> nor to all the house<WH1004> of my father;<WH1> for your servant<WH5650> knows<WH3045> nothing<WH1697> of all this,<WH6996> less or more.<WH1419>"
The king<WH4428> said,<WH559> "You shall surely<WH4191> die,<WH4191> Ahimelech,<WH288> you,<WH1> and all your father's house.<WH1004>"

The king<WH4428> said<WH559> to the guard<WH7323> who stood<WH5324> about him,<WH5437> "Turn, and kill<WH4191> the priests<WH3548> of Yahweh;<WH3068> because their hand<WH3027> also is with David,<WH1732> and because they knew<WH3045> that he fled,<WH1272> and didn't<WH1540> disclose it to me.<WH5650>" But the servants of the king<WH4428> wouldn't<WH14> put forth<WH7971> their hand<WH3027> to fall<WH6293> on the priests<WH3548> of Yahweh.<WH3068>

The king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Doeg,<WH1673> "Turn<WH5437> and attack<WH6293> the priests!<WH3548>" Doeg<WH1673> the Edomite<WH130> turned,<WH5437> and he attacked<WH6293> the priests,<WH3548> and he killed<WH4191> on that day<WH3117> eighty<WH8084> - five<WH2568> people<WH376> who wore<WH5375> a linen<WH906> ephod.<WH646>

He struck<WH5221> Nob,<WH5011> the city<WH5892> of the priests,<WH3548> with the edge<WH6310> of the sword,<WH2719> both men<WH376> and women,<WH802> children<WH5768> and nursing<WH3243> babies,<WH7794> and cattle and donkeys<WH2543> and sheep,<WH7716> with the edge<WH6310> of the sword.<WH2719>
One<WH259> of the sons<WH1121> of Ahimelech,<WH288> the son<WH1121> of Ahitub,<WH285> named<WH8034> Abiathar,<WH54> escaped,<WH4422> and fled<WH1272> after<WH310> David.<WH1732>
Abiathar<WH54> told<WH5046> David<WH1732> that Saul<WH7586> had slain<WH2026> Yahweh<WH3068>'s priests.<WH3548>

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abiathar,<WH54> "I knew<WH3045> on that day,<WH3117> when Doeg<WH1673> the Edomite<WH130> was there,<WH5046> that he would surely tell<WH5046> Saul.<WH7586> I am responsible<WH5437> for the death of all the persons<WH5315> of your father<WH1>'s house.<WH1004>
Stay<WH3427> with me,<WH3372> don't be afraid; for he who seeks<WH1245> my life<WH5315> seeks<WH1245> your life.<WH5315> For with me you shall be in safeguard.<WH4931>"
